Description: A condition where the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
Damage or disease in the heart's major blood vessels.
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue

Description: A chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.
Symptoms: Fatigue, swelling in legs, rapid heartbeat

Description: Improper beating of the heart, whether irregular, too fast, or too slow.
A circulatory condition in which narrowed blood vessels reduce blood flow to the limbs.
Symptoms: Leg pain while walking, numbness, coldness in leg or foot

Description: Occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.
A disorder of the central nervous system that affects movement, often including tremors.
A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.
A neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance, loss of consciousness, or convulsions.
A headache occurring 15 or more days per month for more than three months.
Symptoms: Throbbing pain, nausea, sensitivity to light

Description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make it difficult to breathe.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, wheezing, chest tightness

Description: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.
A serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts.
Symptoms: Loud snoring, gasping during sleep, daytime fatigue

Description: High blood pressure in the arteries to your lungs.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dizziness, chest pressure

Description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar.
A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.
The overproduction of a hormone by the butterfly-shaped gland in the neck.
A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts.
A disorder involving excessive body fat that increases the risk of health problems.
A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints.
An inflammatory disease caused when the immune system attacks its own tissues.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.
A chronic, inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation in the digestive tract.
An immune reaction to eating gluten.
A condition in which skin cells build up and form scales and itchy, dry patches.
A cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts.
Symptoms: Lump, nipple discharge, change in breast shape

Description: Cancer in a man's prostate.
Symptoms: Trouble urinating, pelvic pain, blood in urine

Description: Cancer of the colon or rectum.
Symptoms: Blood in stool, abdominal pain, fatigue

Description: Cancer of blood-forming tissues, hindering the body’s ability to fight infection.
A cancer that begins in the lungs.
Symptoms: Coughing (often with blood), chest pain, weight loss

Description: Cancer of the lymphatic system.
Symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, fatigue, weight loss

Description: The gradual loss of kidney function.
A buildup of fat in the liver.
A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
Chronic liver damage leading to scarring and liver failure.
A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.
A mental health disorder characterized by feelings of worry or fear.
A disorder associated with episodes of mood swings.
A disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.
A disorder in which people have recurring, unwanted thoughts and behaviors.
The most common form of arthritis, occurring when the cartilage wears down.
A condition in which bones become weak and brittle.
Symptoms: Back pain, loss of height, easily fractured bones

Description: Long-term back pain that lasts for 12 weeks or longer.
Symptoms: Persistent pain, stiffness, reduced range of motion

Description: Widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue and memory issues.
A serious gum infection that damages gums and can destroy the jawbone.
Symptoms: Swollen gums, bad breath, tooth loss

Description: Pain and compromised movement of the jaw joint and surrounding muscles.
Symptoms: Jaw pain, difficulty chewing, clicking sound

Description: A cluster of conditions increasing risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes.
Symptoms: High blood pressure, high blood sugar, excess body fat

Description: Post-viral condition with lingering symptoms after COVID-19 recovery.
A disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that doesn't improve with rest.
Symptoms: Extreme fatigue, memory issues, joint pain
